intro: Gibsoniothamnus moldenkeanus, commonly known as the Moldenke's thornbush, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, pod-like fruits. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
